crcl.utils

Class CRCLPosemath

  • java.lang.Object
    • crcl.utils.CRCLPosemath

  • public class CRCLPosemath
extends Object
    Utility class for converting to/from CRCL classes and computing pose multiplications.
    Author:
    Will Shackleford <william.shackleford@nist.gov>,<wshackle@gmail.com>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  CRCLPosemath.PoseFilter
      Interface by classes returning whether transformProgramWithFilter will multiply an endPose of a given command.

      • rzPoint2D

        public static Point2D.Double rzPoint2D(crcl.base.PointType pt)
        Extract the cylindrical r and z coordinates for a Point2D.Double. The X and Y coordinates are combined to compute r as the x of then Point2D.Double and the z is extracted as the y of the new Point2D.Double
        Parameters:
        pt - input point
        Returns:
        Point2D.Double with x and y from PointType

      • rzPoint2D

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getNonNullEndPosition

        public static crcl.base.PoseType getNonNullEndPosition(crcl.base.MoveToType moveToCmdIn)
        Gets the end position from a MoveToType command. (It's primary value is in providing a more informative NullPointerException if the command itself or the end position is null).
        Parameters:
        moveToCmdIn - command to get end position from
        Returns:
        the commands end position

      • compute2DTransform

        public static crcl.base.PoseType compute2DTransform(crcl.base.PointType a1,
                                                    crcl.base.PointType a2,
                                                    crcl.base.PointType b1,
                                                    crcl.base.PointType b2)
                                             throws CRCLException
        Compute a transform such that two points on a rigid body taken in one coordinated system can be tranformed into corresponding two points of the same rigid body on another coordinate system. In order to require only 2 points it is assumed that the Z axis is the same in both coordinate systems. In order to produce reasonable outputs the two points need to be the same distance apart in both coordinate systems both along the Z axis and within the XY plane.
        Parameters:
        a1 - Point 1 on the rigid body in the A coordinate system.
        a2 - Point 2 on the rigid body in the A coordinate system.
        b1 - Point 1 on the rigid body in the B coordinate system.
        b2 - Point 2 on the rigid body in the B coordinate system.
        Returns:
        Pose such that b1 = multiply(pose,a1) and b2 = multiply(pose,a2)
        Throws:
        CRCLException - if the two points are identical.

      • compute2DPmTransform

        public static rcs.posemath.PmPose compute2DPmTransform(rcs.posemath.PmCartesian a1,
                                                       rcs.posemath.PmCartesian a2,
                                                       rcs.posemath.PmCartesian b1,
                                                       rcs.posemath.PmCartesian b2)
                                                throws CRCLException
        Compute a transform such that two points on a rigid body taken in one coordinated system can be tranformed into corresponding two points of the same rigid body on another coordinate system. In order to require only 2 points it is assumed that the Z axis is the same in both coordinate systems. In order to produce reasonable outputs the two points need to be the same distance apart in both coordinate systems both along the Z axis and within the XY plane. Code was tranformed from C code sent from Fred Proctor to Will Shackleford in an email on 2/26/2016 titled "Code to compute pose from pairs of points"
        Parameters:
        a1 - Point 1 on the rigid body in the A coordinate system.
        a2 - Point 2 on the rigid body in the A coordinate system.
        b1 - Point 1 on the rigid body in the B coordinate system.
        b2 - Point 2 on the rigid body in the B coordinate system.
        Returns:
        Pose such that b1 = multiply(pose,a1) and b2 = multiply(pose,a2)
        Throws:
        CRCLException - if any PoseMath exception occurs.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • norm

        public static double norm(crcl.base.VectorType v1)
        Generate L2 norm of Vector WARNING: This function loses the BigDecimal precision and range in VectorType
        Parameters:
        v1 - vector to compute norm of
        Returns:
        norm of input vector

      • normalize

        public static crcl.base.VectorType normalize(crcl.base.VectorType v)
                                      throws CRCLException
        Normalize the vector so its L2 Norm is 1 WARNING: This function uses norm() which loses the BigDecimal precision and range in VectorType
        Parameters:
        v - vector to compute norm of
        Returns:
        normalized input vector
        Throws:
        CRCLException - if norm(v) less than Double.MIN_VALUE

        v1 - first vector
        v2 - second vector
        Returns:
        cross product vector

        public static crcl.base.PoseType toPoseType(rcs.posemath.PmCartesian tran,
                                            rcs.posemath.PmRotationMatrix mat)
                                     throws rcs.posemath.PmException

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • maxDiffDoubleArray

        public static double maxDiffDoubleArray(double[] da,
                                        double[] da2,
                                        double mod)
        Convenience function that computes the maximum of the absolute value of two arrays. The two arrays must be the same length.
        Parameters:
        da - first array of doubles
        da2 - second array of doubles
        mod - optional modulus set to zero or negative to ignore
        Returns:
        maximum difference between corresponding elements of two arrays

      • diffPosesRot

        public static double diffPosesRot(crcl.base.PoseType pose1,
                                  crcl.base.PoseType pose2)
                           throws rcs.posemath.PmException
        Compute the magnitude of a rotation vector between the two poses in radians.
        Parameters:
        pose1 - first pose to compare
        pose2 - second pose to compare
        Returns:
        magnitude of rotation between poses.
        Throws:
        rcs.posemath.PmException - if either pose has an invalid rotation.
